A Field Guide to xaringan Davis Vaughan 2018-05-05 Preface xaringan is a powerful slide editor package built by Yihui Xie, a software engineer at RStudio. While the defaults he sets are incredibly well thought out, most of us can’t resist wanting to tweak our slides in every way imaginable. This book, inspired by Bob Rudis’s 21 Recipes for Mining Twitter with rtweet, is here to serve the purpose of providing solutions to some of the most common tweaks that you might want to perform. This will in no way be an exhaustive list, but hopefully can get new users to xaringan up and running quickly.

About the Author Davis Vaughan is a lover of all things R and Finance. He is graduating with a Master’s in Quantitative Finance in May 2018, with immediate plans to work in the fixed income financial industry. He is the co-author of several packages hosted under the Business Science name including tidyquant, tibbletime, and timetk.
